docs.snippet: It remains to be seen whether the Group of 20 leaders were able to persuade Angela Merkel to alter her stance of self-defeating austerity and piecemeal rescue plans to avert a euro-zone disaster....
docs.abstract: Editorial questions whether leaders from the Group of 20 nations will be able to convince German Chancellor Angela Merkel to alter her stance of self-defeating austerity and piecemeal rescue plans in response to the euro-zone economic crisis; expresses hope that the discussions from the G-20 meeting in Mexico will provide a foundation and political cover for her to take bolder action.
docs.lead_paragraph: It remains to be seen whether the Group of 20 leaders were able to persuade Angela Merkel to alter her stance of self-defeating austerity and piecemeal rescue plans to avert a euro-zone disaster.

headline.print_headline: Environmental Groups Say They Will Fight Drilling Plan
headline.seo: Environmental Coalition to Fight Cuomo’s Fracking Proposal
headline.main: Environmental Groups Say They Will Fight Cuomo’s Gas Drilling Plan

docs.snippet: A coalition of environmental groups will campaign against a proposal being weighed by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to allow hydraulic fracturing in a limited area of New York....
docs.abstract: Coalition of environmental groups plans to campaign against a proposal being weighed by New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo to allow limited drilling for natural gas; groups have had some differences over hydraulic fracturing, but all have signed a joint statement opposing the use of the technique without an independent assessment of its safety.
docs.lead_paragraph: A coalition of environmental groups will campaign against a proposal being weighed by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to allow hydraulic fracturing in a limited area of New York.

docs.snippet: The Department of Defense has identified 1,997 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations....

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Defense Department confirms the deaths of four service members in Afghanistan.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Department of Defense has identified 1,997 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations.

headline.print_headline: Inmate Charged With Murder in 2006 Fire
headline.seo: Samuel Martinez Charged With Murder in 2006 Fatal Brooklyn Fire
headline.main: Inmate Charged With Murder in 2006 Brooklyn Fire

docs.snippet: Samuel Martinez, who is serving a prison sentence for an unrelated burglary, pleaded not guilty to eight counts of second-degree murder in a blaze that killed four people in Crown Heights....
docs.abstract: Samuel Martinez pleads not guilty to eight counts of second-degree murder in 2006 Brooklyn fire that killed two children and their mother; Martinez will not be charged with arson or other crimes in connection with the fire because the statue of limitations has expired.
docs.lead_paragraph: Samuel Martinez, who is serving a prison sentence for an unrelated burglary, pleaded not guilty to eight counts of second-degree murder in a blaze that killed four people in Crown Heights.

headline.print_headline: Jail Term Ends After 20 Days For a Former Rutgers Student
headline.seo: Dharun Ravi, Ex-Rutgers Student Who Spied, Leaves Jail
headline.main: Jail Term Ends After 20 Days for Ex-Rutgers Student

docs.snippet: Dharun Ravi, who was convicted of spying on his roommate having sex with another man, left jail 20 days after beginning a 30-day jail sentence....

keywords.value: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Dharun Ravi, former Rutgers University student who was convicted of spying on roommate Tyler Clementi having sex with another man, is released after serving 20 days of his 30-day jail sentence; early release was granted for his work and good behavior behind bars.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dharun Ravi, who was convicted of spying on his roommate having sex with another man, left jail 20 days after beginning a 30-day jail sentence.

headline.print_headline: Forced Move Raises Anger in West Bank Villages
headline.main: Forced Move Raises Anger in West Bank Villages

docs.snippet: Israeli settlers prepared to evacuate their homes, following a Supreme Court decree declaring parts of Ulpana illegally built on Palestinian land....
docs.abstract: Beit El Journal; some Israelis in the West Bank settlement in Beit El prepare to be forcibly evacuated from their homes following a Supreme Court order declaring that parts of their neighborhood were built on private Palestinian land; area mosque is burned and vandalized, pointing to rising tensions and the instability of radical settlers.

byline.contributor: Rina Castelnuovo contributed reporting from Beit El, and Khaled Abu Aker from Jabaa, West Bank.

docs.lead_paragraph: Israeli settlers prepared to evacuate their homes, following a Supreme Court decree declaring parts of Ulpana illegally built on Palestinian land.

docs.snippet: School-issued debit cards may come with hidden fees and other strings. Congress needs to take a hard look at how banks disburse financial aid to students....
docs.abstract: Editorial urges Congress to examine the increasingly common practice of schools contracting with banks to disburse financial aid dollars to students using debit cards; warns that school-issued debit cards may come with hidden fees and obligations; contends that if schools will not protect their students, Congress must step in.
docs.lead_paragraph: School-issued debit cards may come with hidden fees and other strings. Congress needs to take a hard look at how banks disburse financial aid to students.

docs.snippet: The new standards governing soot proposed by the Environmental Protection Agency will make for cleaner air and were long overdue....
docs.abstract: Editorial welcomes the Environmental Protection Agency's proposal to tighten standards governing fine particles, commonly known as soot, saying the move will make the air that Americans breathe cleaner and is long overdue.
docs.lead_paragraph: The new standards governing soot proposed by the Environmental Protection Agency will make for cleaner air and were long overdue.

docs.snippet: The shooting death of an unarmed black teenager in Florida raises questions about whether racial bias is a factor in the rise of homicides tied to Stand Your Ground laws....

keywords.value: United States Commission on Civil Rights
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Editorial contends that the shooting death of Trayvon Martin raises questions about whether racial bias is a factor in the rise of homicides tied to Stand Your Ground laws like the one in Florida, and that the United States Commission on Civil Rights is right to order an investigation into the issue; asserts that such laws should be repealed and the civil rights inquiry should help make that point.
docs.lead_paragraph: The shooting death of an unarmed black teenager in Florida raises questions about whether racial bias is a factor in the rise of homicides tied to Stand Your Ground laws.
